Name: MINOR ILLUSION
Description: Voucreate a sound or an image of an object withinrange that lasts for the duration. The illusion also ends ifyou dismiss it as an action or cast this spell again.lf you create a sound, its volume can range from awhisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someoneelse's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or anyother sound you choose. The sound continues unabatedthroughout the duration, or you can make discretesounds at different times before the spell ends.lf you create an image of an object-such as a chair,muddy footprints, or a small chest-it must be no largerthan a 5-foot cube. The image can't create sound, light,smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interactionwith the image reveals it to be an illusion, becausethings can pass through it.lf a creature uses its action to examine the sound orimage, the creature can determine that it is an illusionwith a successful Intelligence (Investigation) checkagainst your spell save De. If a creature discerns theillusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint tothe creature.
